main event: A civilian observer in Hampton, Virginia reported seeing a single aluminum-colored object with a bright orange or red color that hovered and drifted westward for about 10 minutes on January 28, 1965.
interesting points: The object appeared longer on one end than the other, similar to an aircraft without wings.
The object maintained a constant altitude as it hovered and drifted westward, then returned to its original position before drifting away again.
The observer stated she probably would not have reported the incident if not for numerous previous sightings in the area.
No sound or trail was reported, and the object's features were indiscernible due to its high altitude.
Despite the apparent extraordinary movement of the object, the report notes that numerous jet aircraft were observed in the immediate vicinity, possibly accounting for some contrails.
sighted object: A single aluminum-colored object with a bright orange or red color
